LR - Legal Roots: The International Journal of Roman Law, Legal History and Comparative Law

The Journal shall publish articles in the various fields of Roman law, ancient Greek law, Byzantine law, medieval and early modern law, as well as the history of the modern codification movements. The Journal shall be available online, accessible through a password. A hard-copy version shall also be made available.

Submissions shall be evaluated by anonymous referees, who are experts in the field treated by the submission. The name(s) of the author(s) shall also be kept anonymous. Each referee will judge the article in question according to a set of criteria provided by the Editorial Board, the content of which shall be determined by the prevailing standards of international scholarship. Based on the readers' reports, the area editor shall communicate the results to the Managing Editors, and then within two weeks to the author him- or herself, making clear the basis of the decision, whether positive, negative, or mixed, and relating whatever suggestions for improvement they make or even insist upon.
